## 1. Feature/Issue Overview

### Name

    A short, descriptive title for this feature, bug, or enhancement (this is often similar to the Title field above).

### Description

    A detailed explanation of the desired feature or the specific problem the proposed change will solve.
    What is the goal of this issue? What should the user experience be?

## 2. Strategy and Stakeholders

### Why

    Explain the core business or technical need this feature addresses. Why is this work important to prioritize now?

### For Who (References to who this feat benefits)

    Identify the primary beneficiaries of this feature.

    - [ ] End-Users (Direct consumers of the product/app)

    - [ ] Developers (Those who maintain or extend the codebase)

    - [ ] Project Managers / Product Owners

    - [ ] Other Stakeholders: [Specify here]

### Who (References to who creates the feat)

    If known, specify the individual or team responsible for implementing this.
    Assigned to:

### How (Implementation Sketch)

    Provide a high-level technical plan or suggestion for how this feature could be implemented.

    List affected components or files.

    Note any critical dependencies or potential technical hurdles.

    (Optional) Link to mockups, designs, or technical spec documents.

## 3. Current Status and Updates

### Current Status

    Please mark the appropriate status:

    - [ ] Pending Review (Initial submission)

    - [ ] Approved / Ready for Work

    - [ ] In Progress (Assigned to: [Assignee Name])

    - [ ] Blocked (Reason: [Explain Blockage])

    - [ ] Complete / Merged

### Status and Update Log

    Use this section to log progress, major decisions, or timeline changes.

    [YYYY-MM-DD]: [Initial triage/decision summary]

    [YYYY-MM-DD]: [Progress update or milestone achieved]

## 4. Pre-PR Testing Guidelines

    Before creating a Pull Request (PR) for this feature, please ensure the following general guidelines are met:

    - [ ] Code Style: Code adheres to the project's style guide and passes all linter/formatter checks.

    - [ ] Functionality: The feature works exactly as described in the Description section above.

    - [ ] Unit Tests: Critical new logic is covered by appropriate unit or integration tests.

    - [ ] Documentation: If necessary (new API, complex change), documentation has been updated.

    - [ ] No Regression: Tested existing core functionalities to ensure no unrelated features were broken.

### Specific Testing Steps

    Provide clear, step-by-step instructions for verifying this feature:

    [Step 1]

    [Step 2]

    [Step 3]
